channel.title: Show IATI: iatikit. A toolkit for using IATI data
channel.description:
It’s been about a month since my last ["Show IATI"](https://discuss.iatistandard.org/search?q=%22show%20iati%22%20user%3Aandylolz%20order%3Alatest) post, so high time for another.
[iatikit](https://iatikit.readthedocs.io) is a python library for analysing IATI data. The [documentation is here](https://iatikit.readthedocs.io). You can install it with:
``` pip install iatikit ```
iatikit makes it easy to download the latest IATI data, and then work with it locally on your machine. It’s intended for those with programming skills, who are looking to analyse or generate insights from IATI data. [Here are a couple of examples](https://iatikit.readthedocs.io/en/stable/examples.html) of the sorts of thing you can use it for.
It’s lacking first class support for a lot of IATI features, but I intend to keep improving and adding to it. If you do find a use for it, please post about that here! If you have any feature requests or find any bugs, please [add them as github issues](https://github.com/pwyf/iatikit/issues). Thanks!

item.title: Show IATI: iatikit. A toolkit for using IATI data
item.dc:creator: andylolz
item.description:
Thanks @SJohns! Really pleased you’ve found it useful.

I’m in the process of adding some basic Transaction support (see pwyf/iatikit#15), and then I think it’ll be significantly more useful.

Read full topic
item.source: Show IATI: iatikit. A toolkit for using IATI data

item.title: Show IATI: iatikit. A toolkit for using IATI data
item.dc:creator: SJohns
item.description:
This is fab @andylolz - thank you for sharing this. I’m not a developer but I’ve been learning Python for the last year or so and creating code using Jupyter notebook. The instructions and examples you give are really clear and easy to follow, and the code is straight forward enough for anyone to have a go. Might even get my Code Clubbers onto it! Recommended.

Read full topic
item.source: Show IATI: iatikit. A toolkit for using IATI data
